intro: Cathartolinum multicaule, commonly known as the multicaule cathartolinum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a soft, velvety texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
